commit.message: Refactor estimation template to enhance clarity and usability; introduce three-pillar framework (Innovation, Scope, People) for quick estimates, and provide detailed scoring and multiplier guidelines. Add JSON/YAML templates for tooling integration and streamline communication with stakeholders through structured templates and examples.

Refactor article content and update navigation links in test-driving-githubs-spec-kit.pug; enhance security policies in layout files; update last build dates in RSS and sitemap; optimize project change frequencies; improve static web app configuration for content security.
Update lastBuildDate and lastmod timestamps in RSS and sitemap XML files
Update version to 9.0.6 and adjust last build dates in various documents and RSS feeds
Update RSS and Sitemap lastBuildDate and lastmod timestamps to reflect recent changes
Update Content Security Policy for Google Analytics support; clarify precedence of Azure Static Web Apps headers
Update styles and scripts to version 9.0.4; synchronize sitemap and RSS feed last modified dates; enhance versioning script to update package.json
Update build version to 1.0.25 and enhance typeahead debugging analysis with detailed investigation notes for Azure Static Web Apps issue
Add YouTube embed best practices and critical configuration requirements to documentation

Update YouTube embed attributes and Content Security Policy across multiple files for improved security and compliance with best practices. Added referrer policy to video embeds and adjusted CSP directives to enhance privacy and functionality. Updated last build dates in RSS and sitemap files to reflect recent changes. Added comprehensive documentation on YouTube embedding best practices.

Update Content Security Policy and version numbers across multiple files

- Enhanced Content Security Policy in HTML and Pug files to include markhazleton.com.
- Updated version numbers in modern-styles.css, scripts.js, and footer sections to v1.0.22.
- Adjusted lastBuildDate in RSS feeds and sitemap to reflect the latest build time.
Update Content Security Policy and version numbers across multiple HTML and Pug files; adjust last build dates in RSS and sitemap XML files.
Update version numbers and last build dates across multiple documents to v1.0.19 and adjust timestamps for RSS and sitemap files.

Update Content Security Policy and version numbers across multiple HTML and XML files

- Enhanced Content Security Policy in task-list-processor.html, trivia-spark-development.html, using-chatgpt-for-developers.html, web-project-mechanics.html, modern-layout.pug, and performance-optimized-layout.pug to include additional sources for scripts, styles, and images.
- Updated version numbers in HTML files for modern-styles.css and scripts.js from v1.0.17 to v1.0.18.
- Modified lastBuildDate in articles-rss.xml and projects-rss.xml to reflect the latest build time.
- Updated lastmod timestamps in sitemap.xml to match the new build time.
- Adjusted Content Security Policy in staticwebapp.config.json for consistency with other files.
Update styles and scripts to version 1.0.17; modify RSS and sitemap last build dates
Merge: Add both Cloudflare Insights and Vimeo support to CSP
Update Content Security Policy to include Cloudflare Insights and Vimeo support

Update article content and improve documentation structure

- Revised introduction in "test-driving-githubs-spec-kit.pug" for clarity and engagement.
- Updated table of contents to reflect new sections and improved navigation.
- Enhanced executive summary with clearer explanations of documentation challenges and solutions.
- Reorganized sections to better highlight key learnings and outcomes from using GitHub Spec Kit.
- Adjusted feedback loop section to emphasize the importance of AI in maintaining documentation accuracy.
- Added detailed descriptions of experiments conducted with Spec Kit, including specific goals and results.
- Updated RSS feed and sitemap with new last modified dates and adjusted change frequencies for better SEO.

feat: Implement auto-incrementing build version system with cache busting

- Added build version management with `build-version.json` to track version, build date, and build number.
- Created `increment-version.js` to handle version increments on each build.
- Updated build scripts to increment version before executing build tasks.
- Integrated versioning into PUG templates for consistent display across all pages.
- Implemented cache busting for CSS and JavaScript files using version query parameters to ensure browsers load the latest assets.
- Enhanced footer in layouts to display current version and build date.
- Updated RSS and sitemap files with new last build dates.

Update content security policy, RSS feeds, and sitemap timestamps; enhance search engine functionality

- Modified the Content Security Policy in `index.html` to include Cloudflare insights.
- Updated `lastBuildDate` in `rss.xml` and `projects-rss.xml` to reflect the latest build time.
- Adjusted `lastmod` dates in `sitemap.xml` for consistency across project URLs.
- Changed the change frequency and priority for the `reactspark` project in `sitemap.xml`.
- Added CORS headers for `search-index.json` in `staticwebapp.config.json`.
- Improved the search engine implementation in `search-engine.js` to ensure global access.
Add searchIndex task to build pipeline configuration
Add search-index.json and fix CSP for Cloudflare Insights
Fix articles.json path - change search-index.json to articles.json
Fix Safari and Android browser date parsing error in articles loading
Update Content Security Policy for Google Analytics across multiple HTML and Pug files to include Cloudflare Insights and improve security settings.

feat: Add structured data for articles and breadcrumbs in layouts

- Implemented JSON-LD structured data for BlogPosting and BreadcrumbList in modern-layout.pug and performance-optimized-layout.pug.
- Updated article header to use <h1> instead of <h2> for better SEO in article-mixins.pug.
- Modified lastBuildDate in rss.xml and lastmod dates in sitemap.xml for consistency.
- Introduced search index generation in build process to enhance search functionality.
- Conducted SEO audit and H1 tag validation, addressing warnings and ensuring proper heading hierarchy.
Update Project Mechanics link to LinkedIn across multiple documents and adjust RSS feed last build dates

Update Project Mechanics links and dependencies

- Replaced old Project Mechanics links with updated URLs across multiple project pages.
- Updated last build dates in RSS and sitemap files.
- Upgraded dependencies in package.json and package-lock.json:
  - glob from 11.0.3 to 12.0.0
  - terser from 5.44.0 to 5.44.1
  - autoprefixer from 10.4.21 to 10.4.22
  - jsdom from 27.1.0 to 27.2.0
  - sass from 1.93.3 to 1.94.1
Update articles RSS feed and remove outdated items; adjust timestamps in article stubs
docs: add SEO summary with implementation roadmap

docs: add comprehensive SEO audit, quick fixes guide, and automation

- Created SEO_AUDIT.md with detailed analysis (30 issues identified)
- Created SEO_QUICK_FIXES.md with actionable 2-hour improvement plan
- Added seo-improvements.js automation script
- Generated sitemap.xml with 13 pages
- Generated robots.txt with proper crawler directives
- Documented metadata recommendations for all pages
- Provided JSON-LD structured data templates
- Included title tag optimization guidelines
- Current SEO score: 65/100, target: 90+/100

Key findings:
- Critical: Duplicate H1 tags, missing meta descriptions
- High Priority: No sitemap/robots.txt, generic titles
- Impact: +25 points possible with quick fixes

Quick wins documented:
1. Fix duplicate H1 (15 min)
2. Add sitemap/robots.txt (DONE)
3. Update meta descriptions (45 min)
4. Optimize title tags (30 min)
5. Add Google Analytics (15 min)
6. Add structured data (15 min)

Total implementation time: 2 hours to achieve 85/100 score
Update project and article RSS feeds, modify navigation links, and clean up sitemap entries

docs: add comprehensive evolution plan and site review for ProjectMechanics

- Created EVOLUTION_PLAN.md with 6-phase roadmap
- Created SITE_REVIEW.md with detailed current state assessment
- Identified critical issues: file naming, frontmatter, content quality
- Defined success metrics and timelines
- Prioritized improvements: content → UX → SEO → automation
- Estimated 20-30 days of development over 3-6 months

Add new HTML pages for change management, conflict management, leadership skills, and project overview

- Created change-management-strategies.html with best practices for managing project changes.
- Developed conflict-management-strategies.html outlining essential strategies for conflict resolution in project teams.
- Added leadership-skills.html focusing on key leadership qualities and strategies for effective team management.
- Introduced overview.html discussing the art and science of project management, including strategies for success.

feat: create standalone ProjectMechanics website and remove from main blog

- Created new projectmechanics-site/ directory with markdown-driven static site generator
- Implemented modern, responsive UI with updated design
- Converted all .pug templates to markdown content format
- Built Node.js-based build system using marked, gray-matter, and fs-extra
- Generated static HTML pages with SEO-optimized meta tags
- Removed ProjectMechanics pages from main blog:
  * Deleted src/pug/projectmechanics/ directory and all .pug files
  * Removed src/pug/layouts/projectmechanics.pug layout
  * Removed src/pug/modules/projectmechanics-mixins.pug
  * Removed src/scss/sections/_projectmechanics-section.scss
  * Removed src/js/projectmechanics.js
  * Moved content files to projectmechanics-site/content/
- Updated src/sections.json to remove projectmechanics references
- Updated src/scss/styles.scss to remove projectmechanics section import

New ProjectMechanics site features:
- Markdown-driven content management
- Modern responsive design with mobile support
- Static site generation for fast, secure deployment
- Simple build process: npm run build
- Ready for deployment to any static hosting service
docs(content): correct repository layout example to use "spec/" and remove data-model.md

docs(constitution): align constitution with copilot-instructions and clarify build/template/SEO rules

- Update Sync Impact Report and bump version to 1.0.1 (ratified 2025-11-02)
- Standardize build path to tools/build/build.js and align build command references with npm scripts
- Rework constitution structure to emphasize Content-First architecture and Build System Modularity
- Clarify that modern-layout.pug auto-generates SEO meta tags from articles.json
- Add reference to src/pug/modules/article-mixins.pug for consistent article components
- Specify copilot/session-YYYY-MM-DD directory for generated AI/Copilot docs
- Expand development workflow, build validation gates, deployment pipeline, and governance/amendment guidance
- Reinforce SEO, accessibility, template formatting, and automated audit requirements

feat(content): consolidate hotfix article and simplify estimation TOC

- Dramatically shorten and refocus hotfix article by consolidating redundant sections (~30% reduction)
  - Replaced verbose hotfix vs. patch prose with a compact comparison table
  - Moved lengthy management-system comparisons into an "Additional Resources" cards section (MoSCoW, RICE, WSJF, Value vs Effort)
  - Integrated core principles into a single "Priority Scoring Framework" block
  - Converted checklist from 15 interactive checkboxes to three compact lists for faster scanning
  - Reworked common pitfalls into compact cards with icons and colored headers for clearer visual hierarchy
  - Slimmed down key takeaways into a single alert with inline core principles

- Simplified client JS for the hotfix page
  - Removed checklist progress tracking, print functionality, and keyboard shortcuts
  - Consolidated DOMContentLoaded handlers and streamlined event listeners
  - Simplified smooth-scrolling and back-to-top behavior for smaller, more maintainable script

- Updated templates and HTML
  - Updated PUG source and compiled HTML to reflect layout, markup and styling changes
  - Updated quick-estimation article TOC: shortened labels and removed less-relevant TOC items to reduce clutter

- Add copilot consolidation summary documenting changes and rationale

feat(content): expand & restructure "Building a Quick Estimation Template"

- Lead with a concrete "4 PM Estimation Crisis" example and visual ASCII flow
- Deepen Innovation/Scope/People factor explanations with spectra, examples, common mistakes, and calibration questions
- Add data-driven justification for progressive multipliers (historical averages + red-flag threshold)
- Add practical sections: Team adoption roadmap, Failure story, Python implementation, Method comparison table, Quick Reference card
- Improve mappings, AI guidance, reality-checks, cognitive-load guidance, and general writing polish
- Add comprehensive ARTICLE_IMPROVEMENT_SUMMARY documenting changes

feat(content): rewrite "Test Driving GitHub Spec Kit" article to emphasize documentation drift and the post-implementation feedback loop

- Rename sections/ids and update TOC (from-vibe-coding -> documentation-drift, ai-struggles -> feedback-examples)
- Add new feedback-loop section with side-by-side comparison cards and a path-resolution example
- Rework executive summary, results, conclusion and outcome copy to highlight 20-minute spec sync, institutional knowledge, and zero documentation debt
- Adjust metrics/outcome ordering and wording to reflect documented patterns, warning remediation, and test documentation philosophy

feat(content): restructure "Test Driving GitHub's Spec Kit" and update site metadata - Rework article to lead with the documentation-drift thesis and AI feedback-loop solution: update TOC, headings, body copy, metrics, conclusion, and decision criteria (when to use / skip Spec Kit). - Update source PUG and generated HTML for the article (src/pug/... and docs/articles/...). - Revise SEO/OG/Twitter metadata (titles, descriptions, keywords, image alts) in articles.json / src/articles.json and generated pages. - Rename article title in sections.json and update article summary/keywords to emphasize "AI‑maintained documentation" and "zero documentation debt". - Update RSS feeds (src/rss.xml, rss.xml, articles-rss.xml, docs/articles-rss.xml) to use new title/description/pubDate and bump lastBuildDate. - Update sitemaps (src/sitemap.xml, docs/sitemap.xml) lastmod timestamps and increase changefreq/priority for the article. - Minor fixes: adjust article-stub time, remove extraneous
lines in multiple project index pages, and update several projectmechanics card link titles/descriptions. - Add copilot session notes documenting the restructure (copilot/session-2025-11-02/spec-kit-article-restructure.md).

feat(content): revise "Test Driving GitHub Spec Kit" article, improve PUG rules & accessibility

- Replace articleHero/articleHeader mixins with inline hero/header; simplify and tighten lead copy
- Update article content and headings (case study renamed to WebSpark.HttpClientUtility, revised metrics/time estimates, clearer spec wording)
- Add Post-Implementation Feedback Loop section, lessons/alerts, and "What I Learned" weaknesses
- Improve repository-layout explanation and add informational and validation callouts
- Fix PUG period-continuation/link markup (use HTML anchors or split paragraphs) to prevent build issues
- Add aria-labels to tables and accordion buttons for better accessibility
- Regenerate corresponding docs HTML with content/layout updates
- Extend .github/copilot-instructions.md with "Period Continuation Syntax Rules" and examples to prevent PUG formatting errors

feat(content): add "Test Driving GitHub's Spec Kit" case study and update site metadata/feeds

- Add full Case Studies article (content, pug template and HTML) with expanded title, subtitle, author, summary, conclusion, tests/examples and increased read time
- Update articles.json / src/articles.json and sections.json entries (name, description, keywords, lastmod, publishedDate, estimatedReadTime, seo/og/twitter metadata)
- Insert article into RSS feeds (docs/src) and update feed lastBuildDate timestamps
- Add article URL to sitemap(s) and refresh lastmod/changefreq/priority for affected entries
- Update src/article-stub.html timestamp
- Update multiple projectmechanics pages to refresh related-article cards and links
- Misc: sync projects-rss.xml timestamps and several src/docs feed/sitemap timestamps to reflect changes

fix(ai): handle empty OpenAI responses, add defensive logging, relax JSON schema strictness

- ArticleServiceHelpers.cs
  - Changed json_schema.strict = true -> false for SEO and social schema to allow partial results
  - Added debug logging of raw API responses for Steps 2 & 3
  - Added checks for empty/null choices content; warn, log error via _aiLogger and return empty result objects instead of throwing
  - Log AI response/debug info and preserve existing AI interaction logging behavior

- Add diagnostics & notes
  - Add AI_EMPTY_RESPONSE_FIX.md, AI_GENERATION_FAILURE_ANALYSIS.md, SCHEMA_FIX_APPLIED.md documenting the issue, analysis, and applied fix
  - Add helper scripts: analyze-ai-logs.ps1, compare-steps.ps1, test-ai-fix.ps1 for local troubleshooting/verification

- Content / site updates
  - Add new article "Test Driving GitHub's Spec Kit" (src content, pug, html) and update articles data (src/articles.json, docs/articles.json)
  - Update sections.json to include the new article and increment article counts
  - Update RSS and projects RSS (src/rss.xml, src/articles-rss.xml, src/projects-rss.xml, docs/rss.xml, docs/articles-rss.xml) to include new item and adjust pubDate/lastBuildDate
  - Update sitemap.xml (src/docs) entries and lastmod/changefreq/priority for affected pages
  - Bump styles.css cache-bust query string across multiple projectmechanics pages and update article stub published time

This prevents JSON deserialization crashes when the API returns empty content, improves observability for debugging, and publishes new content & site metadata updates.

Add AI response logging, multi-step article generation helpers, new estimation article, and site + RSS/sitemap updates - Implement comprehensive AI response logging and multi-step AI generation helpers: - Add AiResponseLogger service (logs step interactions, sessions, errors; cleanup; retrieval APIs). - Add Generation models: SeoMetadataResult, SocialMediaResult, ConclusionResult. - Add ArticleServiceHelpers partial with 4-step generation flow (content, SEO extraction, social media, conclusion), YouTube ID extraction, synchronous wrapper and SEO statistics. - Add extensive documentation and operational guides (AI_RESPONSE_LOGGING_GUIDE.md, IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md, LOGGING_* docs, MULTI_STEP_AI_* plans). - Add verify-logging.ps1 for quick validation. - Add new article "Building a Quick Estimation Template When You Have Almost Nothing to Go On": - Add source content (src/content/*.md), pug template (src/pug/articles/...pug), generated HTML (docs/articles/...html). - Add article entry to src/articles.json and sections.json so site index and navigation include the new article. - Add article to sitemap.xml and sitemap in docs (with lastmod) and include item in articles-rss.xml / src/rss.xml. - Update site layout and styling: - Remove extra
after navbars in multiple docs pages to tighten layout. - Remove explicit
in modern layout and adjust content flow. - Update modern-styles.scss to add body padding-top (56px) to account for fixed navbar; include responsive rule. - Update RSS, sitemap and timestamps: - Add new article item to RSS feeds (src/articles-rss.xml and src/rss.xml) and update lastBuildDate. - Update sitemap.xml (docs and src) to include new article and refresh lastmod timestamps for site pages and project entries. - Add logging / deployment support content: - Add large set of supporting docs about logging configuration, Serilog fix and quick reference, and verification steps. - Add logs/ai-responses retention defaults and guidance in docs. - Minor and housekeeping: - Ensure canonical, open graph and twitter metadata present for new article. - Wire article social share button and floating LinkedIn share in article page. - Sanitize filenames and logging JSON serializer options in logger. - Add many Markdown/HTML/Pug assets and large documentation artifacts. Notes: - The commit focuses on adding robust AI logging, breaking AI article generation into smaller, more reliable steps, introducing a new article, and aligning site feeds/sitemaps/styles to support fixed-navbar layout and new content. - These changes add new services and docs; confirm DI registration for AiResponseLogger/ArticleService in Program.cs when deploying and ensure logs/ directory is excluded from version control (.gitignore).
fix: simplify content prep for GPT-5 - send only title/description/section
fix: increase HTTP timeout to 5 minutes for GPT-5 API calls
fix: omit temperature parameter for GPT-5 (only supports default value of 1)
docs: update GPT-5 documentation with max_completion_tokens fix
fix: use max_completion_tokens for GPT-5 instead of max_tokens
debug: add error logging for OpenAI API failures
docs: add GPT-5 upgrade documentation
feat: upgrade to GPT-5 model for article generation
fix: increase OpenAI max_tokens to prevent JSON truncation
docs: add Phase 1 completion documentation
feat: implement markdown to Pug conversion
Merge feature/content-externalization into main
chore: migrate all article content to external markdown files
docs: add quick start guide for migration
docs: add complete implementation summary for content externalization
feat: implement content externalization to external markdown files

feat(specify): update constitution to 1.1.0 — add AI content generation & build caching

- Add VI. AI-Powered Content Generation principle and rationale
- Point build orchestrator to tools/build/build.js and require intelligent caching (.build-cache/)
- Expand Technology Standards, QA, and workflow notes for AI integration, logging, and caching
- Add version bump and amend last amended date to 2025-11-01
chore(site): reformat src/sections.json and update artifacts/ssl.json days_remaining

Update stylesheet version, refresh content cards, bump deps, and update RSS/sitemap timestamps

- Update CSS cache-buster query to ?version=20251101 across project mechanics pages (docs/projectmechanics/*) to force stylesheet refresh.
- Refresh related content cards and internal article links/titles/descriptions across multiple pages (issue-management, leadership section pages, program-management-office, project-life-cycle, project-meetings, solution-architect, accountability/evolution/from-features pages) to surface updated article highlights.
- Bump development dependencies in package.json and package-lock.json:
  - cssnano -> 7.1.2, dayjs -> 1.11.19, jsdom -> 27.1.0, npm-check-updates -> 19.1.2, sass -> 1.93.3 (and propagate related lockfile changes).
  - Add/update several lockfile entries and transient deps (e.g. @acemir/cssom, baseline-browser-mapping, browserslist and various postcss-related packages) to align with updated packages.
- Update RSS feeds and sitemap timestamps:
  - src/articles-rss.xml, src/projects-rss.xml, src/rss.xml lastBuildDate updated to Sat, 01 Nov 2025 14:56:05 GMT.
  - projects RSS pubDate values updated to the same Nov 01 timestamp.
  - src/sitemap.xml lastmod and multiple project <lastmod> entries updated to 2025-11-01T14:56:05-05:00; adjusted changefreq/priority for net-9-sample-mvc-crud to weekly/0.6.
- Misc: small content and metadata adjustments to improve SEO and keep featured cards current.

Reason: content refresh and maintenance — ensure visitors see updated highlights and use latest dev tooling / dependency fixes.

chore(docs): simplify articles, streamline templates, update navigation and sections

- Simplify "Developing MarkHazleton.com" (src pug + generated HTML): remove heavy styling/accordions, streamline hero/TOC, consolidate build/deploy/dev sections and code blocks for documentation-style layout
- Simplify "Moving to MarkHazleton.com" (src pug + generated HTML): replace hero with concise introduction, reorganize TOC and migration guidance, add troubleshooting/timeline and final resources
- Update many projectmechanics pages to refresh related article links and card copy (ensure recommendations match updated articles)
- Normalize/refresh src/sections.json content formatting and article entries
- Bump article timestamp in article-stub.html
- Add copilot session ARTICLE_SIMPLIFICATION_REPORT.md documenting the simplification and validation results

feat(specify): add speckit prompts, templates, constitution, and PowerShell tooling

Add comprehensive spec-driven workflow scaffolding:
- New speckit prompt definitions (.github/prompts): specify, plan, tasks, implement, clarify, checklist, analyze, constitution
- New .specify templates: spec-template.md, plan-template.md, tasks-template.md, checklist-template.md, agent-file-template.md
- Add project constitution (.specify/memory/constitution.md)
- PowerShell tooling (.specify/scripts/powershell): common.ps1, check-prerequisites.ps1, create-new-feature.ps1, setup-plan.ps1, update-agent-context.ps1 (agent context generation/update)
- Add uvx-tools.ps1 helper script

This adds read-only analysis prompts, generation templates, and scripts to drive feature creation, planning, task generation, agent context updates, and prerequisite checks.

chore(site): refresh generated artifacts, bump css cache-bust and commander

- bump CSS cache-bust to ?version=20251026 across project mechanics pages
- update RSS/feeds (articles/projects/root) lastBuildDate and item pubDate to 2025-10-26T21:55:43 GMT (including src copies)
- update sitemap lastmod timestamps to 2025-10-26T21:55:43-05:00 (including src copies)
- update article timestamp in article-stub to October 26, 2025
- correct artifacts/ssl.json days_remaining (40 -> 37)
- bump commander dev dependency to ^14.0.2 (package.json + package-lock.json)
- refresh several sidebar card links/titles/descriptions in project mechanics pages

chore: add empty <code-changes> placeholders to changes manifest

Populate the changes manifest with multiple empty <code-changes> entries as placeholders.
This commit does not introduce any functional or behavioral changes to the codebase —
all entries are empty and intended to reserve space for future change descriptions.

No source files or runtime code were modified.

Update sections.json, sitemap.xml, and add local settings for Claude

- Updated sections.json to include detailed articles across various categories, ensuring accurate article counts and descriptions.
- Modified sitemap.xml to reflect updated last modified dates and adjusted change frequencies for specific project URLs.
- Added local settings configuration for Claude to manage permissions for npm commands.

feat(audit): Implement comprehensive site audit system with intelligent error handling and reporting

- Consolidated multiple audit checks into a single command `npm run audit`
- Added categories for Structural Validation, SEO & Accessibility, Performance, and Code Quality
- Enhanced error handling to distinguish between critical and non-critical issues
- Improved reporting with color-coded output and categorized results
- Integrated Lighthouse CI with Windows-specific fixes for permission errors and process termination
- Created a custom Lighthouse wrapper for better error handling and reporting
- Updated package.json to include new audit command

Fix SEO issues: H1 tag structure and canonical URL validation

- Fixed heading hierarchy in exploratory-data-analysis-eda-using-python.pug
  * Changed multiple h3 tags to h2 for proper structure (Table of Contents, EDA Process, Automating Analysis, FAQ, Summary, Glossary)
- Fixed heading hierarchy in from-features-to-outcomes.pug
  * Changed section headings from h3 to h2 (What are features?, What are outcomes?, Measurable Outcomes)
- Fixed heading hierarchy in search.pug
  * Added visually-hidden h2 tag for proper h1 > h2 > h3 structure
- Updated canonical URL validation script (validate-canonical-urls.js)
  * Added handling for directory-style slugs ending with '/' to check for index.html files
  * Now validates all 102 articles correctly instead of missing 4

✅ Canonical URLs: 102/102 validated successfully
✅ H1 Structure: Reduced from 5 problematic files to 2 (only template files remain)
✅ SEO Compliance: Addresses Bing Webmaster Tools warnings for multiple H1 tags and broken canonical URLs

Update RSS and sitemap last modified dates; add comprehensive test review report and performance fallback for Windows compatibility

- Updated <lastBuildDate> in src/rss.xml and src/sitemap.xml to reflect new timestamps.
- Added TEST_REVIEW_REPORT.md detailing testing strategy, findings, and recommendations for the Mark Hazleton Blog.
- Introduced performance-fallback.js for alternative performance testing when Lighthouse fails on Windows.
- Implemented windows-safe-test.js to handle Windows-specific issues with Lighthouse and pa11y, ensuring reliable test execution.

Refactor TailwindSpark article layout and styling for improved readability and consistency

- Updated hero section background and text styles for better contrast
- Simplified card borders and headers across multiple sections
- Enhanced text color and utility classes for improved accessibility
- Consolidated conclusion and technical implementation details into a more cohesive structure
- Adjusted demo application sections for uniformity in card design
- Improved hover effects and loading states with consistent styling

Add Font Awesome Audit Tool and Social Icons Analysis

- Introduced a standalone Font Awesome Audit Tool to scan PUG files for Font Awesome class references and suggest Bootstrap Icons replacements.
- Documented the tool's features, usage, and output in FONTAWESOME_AUDIT_TOOL.md.
- Analyzed social icons issues due to the removal of Font Awesome from dependencies, detailed in SOCIAL_ICONS_ANALYSIS.md.
- Updated PUG templates to replace Font Awesome classes with Bootstrap Icons equivalents.
- Generated a JSON report of the audit findings, saved as fontawesome-audit-report.json.
- Implemented both standalone and extended versions of the audit tool with glob support.

Refactor articles and documentation for clarity and relevance

- Updated article links and descriptions in the project mechanics documentation to reflect new content.
- Revised the layout and content of the "Engineering Metrics: Git Spark Story" article for improved readability and structure.
- Enhanced the clarity of sections discussing metrics, AI contributions, and the limitations of Git history.
- Streamlined the presentation of key insights and lessons learned from the development of the git-spark tool.

Implement comprehensive performance optimizations including critical CSS extraction, JavaScript tracking improvements, and CSS bloat reduction

- Added PERFORMANCE_OPTIMIZATION_REPORT.md detailing implemented solutions and expected improvements.
- Developed CSSOptimizer tool to identify and remove unused CSS rules.
- Created JSTrackingOptimizer for analyzing and optimizing JavaScript tracking scripts.
- Implemented quick-performance-implementation.js for applying key performance fixes across articles.
- Updated key articles to use performance-optimized layout.
- Ensured GDPR compliance for tracking scripts and created consent-aware tracking implementation.
Implement feature X to enhance user experience and fix bug Y in module Z
fix: resolve high-severity tar-fs vulnerability (CVE-2024-XXXX)
Update git-spark report before email address history rewrite
Refactor code structure for improved readability and maintainability
Add initial HTML structure and SEO metadata for WebSpark Bootswatch project page

Refactor projects.json with new structure and metadata

Completely restructured and reorganized the `projects.json` file:
- Replaced old project entries with detailed, consistent metadata.
- Enhanced `seo` section with fields for improved search optimization.
- Added `og` and `twitter` metadata for better social media sharing.
- Expanded `repository` section with GitHub details for each project.
- Updated `promotion` section with deployment pipeline and environments.
- Added new projects, including Net 9 Sample MVC CRUD, PromptSpark,
  ReactSpark, PrismSpark, and more, with comprehensive metadata.
- Improved maintainability and robustness of the file.

feat: Add tools for downloading Google Fonts, generating placeholders, and updating RSS feed

- Implemented FontDownloader to download Google Fonts for local hosting, including CSS generation and fallback handling.
- Created PlaceholderGenerator to generate local SVG placeholder images for various sizes, including a generic fallback.
- Developed updateProjectsRssFeed script to generate an RSS feed from projects.json, including project descriptions and metadata.

Enhanced SEO, AI, and project management features

- Added comprehensive SEO and social media metadata generation.
- Introduced fallback mechanisms for AI content generation.
- Improved project creation/editing UI with dynamic elements.
- Enhanced logging, validation, and error handling in services.
- Updated documentation to reflect new features and workflows.
- Added new test endpoints for debugging and validation.
